title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. : edit .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look Travis AppVeyor build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Please note natserv project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: details.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Check discussion forum think issue requires longer form discussion.

title: natserv
text: natserv NatureServe R client NatureServe non-profit organization provides wildlife conservation related data various groups including public. NatureServe site: https://services.natureserve.org NatureServe API docs: https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/ functions package prefixed ns_ prevent collision pkgs. longer need API key. See also taxize book (https://taxize.dev/) manual working taxonomic data R, including NatureServe data.

title: natserv
text: Stable version CRAN Development version
code: install.packages("natserv") remotes::install_github("ropensci/natserv") library('natserv')

title: natserv
text: See vignette (https://docs.ropensci.org/natserv/articles/natserv.html) examples.

title: natserv
text: Please report issues bugs. License: MIT Get citation information natserv R citation(package = 'natserv') Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: natserv introduction
text: NatureServe non-profit organization provides biodiversity data freely online. maintain database comprised data natural heritage programs conservation data centers - database includes information conservation status, taxonomy, geographic distribution, life history information 70,000 species plants, animals, fungi Canada United States. can find information data coverage (https://explorer.natureserve.org/AboutTheData/DataCoverage), data sources (https://explorer.natureserve.org/AboutTheData/Sources) website. NatureServe also hosts data ecological communities/systems conservation status. small amounts data can easily collected using online NatureServe explorer site (http://explorer.natureserve.org/), downloading species data way incredibly slow. Thus natserv born. R package can access NatureServe’s online API rapid downloading conservation data, allows easy access multiple species’ data sets, loads data directly R session.

what: Installing natserv from CRAN or GitHub
title: natserv introduction
text: Stable version: Development version: successful installation, load package environment:
code: install.packages("natserv") remotes::install_github("ropensci/natserv") library(natserv)

title: natserv introduction
text: natserv’s functions prefixed ns_ avoid confusion packages - functions provided natserv:
code: cat(paste(" -", paste(sprintf("`%s`", sort(getNamespaceExports("natserv"))), collapse = "\n - "))) #>  - `ns_altid` #>  - `ns_ecohier` #>  - `ns_export` #>  - `ns_export_status` #>  - `ns_id` #>  - `ns_search_comb` #>  - `ns_search_eco` #>  - `ns_search_spp`

title: natserv introduction
text: ’s three functions search: combined: supports searching species ecosystems using search criteria applicable types records species: supports searching species; extends search criteria available Combined Search include support additional criteria applicable species records ecosystem: supports searching ecosystems; extends search criteria available Combined Search include support additional criteria applicable ecosystems records Combined search Species search Ecosystem search

(TSN 18781)" #> $ uniqueId : chr "ELEMENT_GLOBAL.2.154701" #> $ elcode : chr "PDRAN0F010" #> $ conceptRefFullCitation : chr "Kartesz, J.T. 1994. A synonymized checklist of the vascular flora of the United States, Canada, and Greenland. title: natserv introduction
text: ns_export() uses search interface ns_search* functions, instead downloading data immediately, ns_export() creates “download job”, eventually provides compressed JSON file can download. can pass output ns_export() ns_export_status() get status job state equals “Finished”, can read data R, e.g, jsonlite:
code: x <- ns_export(text = "robin") x #> [1] "7a107bea-b98d-4b5a-87b3-456ea2194f07" res <- ns_export_status(x) #> $state #> [1] "Finished" #>  #> $data #> $data$success #> [1] TRUE #> $percentComplete #> [1] 100 #> $successful #> [1] TRUE #> $error #> ... res$data$url #> [1] "https://explorer-downloads.natureserve.org/shortTerm/explorer/taxaSearchExports/2020-05-15/7a107bea-b98d-4b5a-87b3-456ea2194f07.json" tibble::as_tibble(jsonlite::fromJSON(res$data$url)) #> # A tibble: 126 x 14 #>    elementGlobalId uniqueId nsxUrl elcode scientificName formattedScient… primaryCommonNa… primaryCommonNa… roundedGRank #>              <int> <chr>    <chr>  <chr>  <chr>          <chr>            <chr>            <chr>            <chr> #>  1          100637 ELEMENT… /Taxo… ABPBJ… Copsychus sau… <i>Copsychus sa… Oriental Magpie… EN               G5 #>  2          102323 ELEMENT… /Taxo… ABPBJ… Turdus grayi   <i>Turdus grayi… Clay-colored Th… EN               G5 #>  3          102179 ELEMENT… /Taxo… ABPBJ… Turdus migrat… <i>Turdus migra… American Robin   EN               G5 #>  4          105536 ELEMENT… /Taxo… ABPBJ… Turdus migrat… <i>Turdus migra… Western America… EN               TU #>  5          105850 ELEMENT… /Taxo… ABPBJ… Turdus rufopa… <i>Turdus rufop… Rufous-backed R… EN               G5 #>  6          100589 ELEMENT… /Taxo… AFC4B… Peristedion g… <i>Peristedion … Slender Searobin EN               GNR #>  7          105826 ELEMENT… /Taxo… AFC4B… Prionotus ala… <i>Prionotus al… Spiny Searobin   EN               GNR #>  8          101394 ELEMENT… /Taxo… AFC4B… Prionotus car… <i>Prionotus ca… Northern Searob… EN               G5 #>  9          100276 ELEMENT… /Taxo… AFC4B… Prionotus evo… <i>Prionotus ev… Striped Searobin EN               G5 #> 10          103595 ELEMENT… /Taxo… AFC4B… Prionotus lon… <i>Prionotus lo… Bigeye Searobin  EN               G5 #> # … with 116 more rows, and 29 more variables: nations <list>, lastModified <chr>, speciesGlobal$usesaCode <chr>, #> #   $cosewicCode <chr>, $saraCode <chr>, $synonyms <list>, $otherCommonNames <list>, $kingdom <chr>, $phylum <chr>, #> # title: Get a summary of the upper level hierarchy for an Ecosystem record — ns_ecohier
code: if (FALSE) { ns_ecohier("ELEMENT_GLOBAL.2.683060") }

title: Search exports — ns_export
text: Search exports

title: Search exports — ns_export
code: ns_export(   text = NULL,   text_adv = NULL,   status = NULL,   location = NULL,   record_type = NULL,   record_subtype = NULL,   modified_since = NULL,   format = "json",   lang = "en",   ... )  ns_export_status(id, ...)

title: Search exports — ns_export
text: text (character) basic text search, equiavalent text_adv matchAgainst="allNames" operator="similarTo" text_adv (list) advanced search, must specify following three elements: searchToken, matchAgainst, operator. see https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/#_advanced_text_search_parameter status (character) conservation status, one G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, GH, GX, GNR, GNA, GU. case insensitive location (list) location, country sub-country. specify either nation nation subnation. expects two-letter ISO code record_type (character) limit results record type, one "species" "ecosystem" record_subtype (character) limit results record sub-type, one : "class", "subclass", "formation", "division", "macrogroup", "group", "alliance", "association", "terrestrial_ecological_system" modified_since (character) search records modified since given time. value must date time UTC offset ISO 8601 format. optional format (character) output format, one "json" "xlsx" lang (character) language, one "en", "es", "fr" ... Curl options passed verb-GET id (character) job id, output ns_export()

title: Search exports — ns_export
text: ns_export() returns single character string (job id) ns_export_status() returns list metadata concerning status export

title: Search exports — ns_export
text: https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/

title: Search exports — ns_export
code: if (FALSE) { x <- ns_export(text = "robin") res <- ns_export_status(x) str(res) res$state res$data$errorMessage res$data$url  w <- ns_export(text_adv = list(searchToken = "western",   matchAgainst="allScientificNames", operator="startsWith")) m <- ns_export_status(w) head(jsonlite::fromJSON(m$data$url)) }

title: Get taxon by uid — ns_id
text: Get taxon uid

title: Get taxon by uid — ns_id
code: ns_id(uid, ...)

title: Get taxon by uid — ns_id
text: uid (character) NatureServe taxon id (taxon’s Element Global UID). required. ... Curl options passed verb-GET

title: Get taxon by uid — ns_id
text: list lots elements

title: Get taxon by uid — ns_id
text: see https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/#_taxon_data_model details response data

title: Get taxon by uid — ns_id
text: https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/

title: Get taxon by uid — ns_id
code: if (FALSE) { ns_id("ELEMENT_GLOBAL.2.154701") }

title: Combined search — ns_search_comb
text: Combined search

title: Combined search — ns_search_comb
code: ns_search_comb(   text = NULL,   text_adv = NULL,   status = NULL,   location = NULL,   record_type = NULL,   record_subtype = NULL,   modified_since = NULL,   page = NULL,   per_page = NULL,   ... )

title: Combined search — ns_search_comb
text: text (character) basic text search, equiavalent text_adv matchAgainst="allNames" operator="similarTo" text_adv (list) advanced search, must specify following three elements: searchToken, matchAgainst, operator. see https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/#_advanced_text_search_parameter status (character) conservation status, one G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, GH, GX, GNR, GNA, GU. case insensitive location (list) location, country sub-country. specify either nation nation subnation. expects two-letter ISO code record_type (character) limit results record type, one "species" "ecosystem" record_subtype (character) limit results record sub-type, one : "class", "subclass", "formation", "division", "macrogroup", "group", "alliance", "association", "terrestrial_ecological_system" modified_since (character) search records modified since given time. value must date time UTC offset ISO 8601 format. optional page (integer) Zero-indexed page number; default: 0. optional per_page (integer) Records per page; default: 20. optional ... Curl options passed verb-GET

title: Combined search — ns_search_comb
text: https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/

title: Combined search — ns_search_comb
code: if (FALSE) { ns_search_comb(text = "robin") ns_search_comb(text_adv = list(searchToken = "western",   matchAgainst="allScientificNames", operator="startsWith")) ns_search_comb(status = "G1") ns_search_comb(location = list(nation = "US")) ns_search_comb(location = list(nation = "US", subnation = "VA")) ns_search_comb(record_type = "species") ns_search_comb(record_subtype = "macrogroup") ns_search_comb(modified_since = "2020-04-30T00:00:00+0000") ns_search_comb(page = 0, per_page = 2) }

title: Ecosystem search — ns_search_eco
text: Ecosystem search

title: Ecosystem search — ns_search_eco
code: ns_search_eco(   text = NULL,   text_adv = NULL,   status = NULL,   location = NULL,   ecosystem_taxonomy = NULL,   record_subtype = NULL,   modified_since = NULL,   page = NULL,   per_page = NULL,   ... )

title: Ecosystem search — ns_search_eco
text: text (character) basic text search, equiavalent text_adv matchAgainst="allNames" operator="similarTo" text_adv (list) advanced search, must specify following three elements: searchToken, matchAgainst, operator. see https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/#_advanced_text_search_parameter status (character) conservation status, one G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, GH, GX, GNR, GNA, GU. case insensitive location (list) location, country sub-country. specify either nation nation subnation. expects two-letter ISO code ecosystem_taxonomy (character) classification code higher level (ancestor) ecosystem. E.g.'s: "1" (Class code), "1.B" (Subclass code), "1.B.2" (Formation code), "1.B.2.Nd" (Division code), "M886" (Macrogroup key), "G206" (Group key), "A3328" (Alliance Key) record_subtype (character) limit results record sub-type, one : "class", "subclass", "formation", "division", "macrogroup", "group", "alliance", "association", "terrestrial_ecological_system" modified_since (character) search records modified since given time. value must date time UTC offset ISO 8601 format. optional page (integer) Zero-indexed page number; default: 0. optional per_page (integer) Records per page; default: 20. optional ... Curl options passed verb-GET

title: Ecosystem search — ns_search_eco
text: https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/

title: Ecosystem search — ns_search_eco
code: if (FALSE) { ns_search_eco(text = "robin") ns_search_eco(text_adv = list(searchToken = "bird",   matchAgainst = "allNames", operator="similarTo")) ns_search_eco(status = "G1") ns_search_eco(location = list(nation = "US")) ns_search_eco(location = list(nation = "US", subnation = "VA")) ns_search_eco(ecosystem_taxonomy = "M067") ns_search_eco(record_subtype = "macrogroup") ns_search_eco(modified_since = "2020-04-30T00:00:00+0000") ns_search_eco(page = 0, per_page = 2) }

title: Species search — ns_search_spp
text: Species search

title: Species search — ns_search_spp
code: ns_search_spp(   text = NULL,   text_adv = NULL,   status = NULL,   location = NULL,   species_taxonomy = NULL,   record_subtype = NULL,   modified_since = NULL,   page = NULL,   per_page = NULL,   ... )

title: Species search — ns_search_spp
text: text (character) basic text search, equiavalent text_adv matchAgainst="allNames" operator="similarTo" text_adv (list) advanced search, must specify following three elements: searchToken, matchAgainst, operator. see https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/#_advanced_text_search_parameter status (character) conservation status, one G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, GH, GX, GNR, GNA, GU. case insensitive location (list) location, country sub-country. specify either nation nation subnation. expects two-letter ISO code species_taxonomy (list) species taxonomy. either list level scientificTaxonomy (scientific name), just informalTaxonomy (vernacular name). possible level values: "kingdom", "phylum", "class", "order", "family", "genus" record_subtype (character) limit results record sub-type, one : "class", "subclass", "formation", "division", "macrogroup", "group", "alliance", "association", "terrestrial_ecological_system" modified_since (character) search records modified since given time. value must date time UTC offset ISO 8601 format. optional page (integer) Zero-indexed page number; default: 0. optional per_page (integer) Records per page; default: 20. optional ... Curl options passed verb-GET

title: Species search — ns_search_spp
text: https://explorer.natureserve.org/api-docs/

title: Species search — ns_search_spp
code: if (FALSE) { ns_search_spp(text = "robin") ns_search_spp(text_adv = list(searchToken = "bird",    matchAgainst = "allNames", operator="similarTo")) ns_search_spp(status = "G1") ns_search_spp(location = list(nation = "US")) ns_search_spp(location = list(nation = "US", subnation = "VA")) ns_search_spp(species_taxonomy = list(scientificTaxonomy = "Animalia", level = "kingdom")) ns_search_spp(species_taxonomy = list(informalTaxonomy = "birds")) ns_search_spp(record_subtype = "macrogroup") ns_search_spp(modified_since = "2020-04-30T00:00:00+0000") ns_search_spp(page = 0, per_page = 2) }

title: natserv 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-16

title: natserv 1.0.0
text: old functions gone replaced new functions. NatureServe released new API ending support old one 15 June 2020, ’s reason support old API. See docs (https://docs.ropensci.org/natserv/) example usage (#21)

title: natserv 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-17

title: natserv 0.4.0
text: update vignette use rmarkdown style, make sure vignette title (#20)

title: natserv 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-01-23

title: natserv 0.3.0
text: gains vignette: “Introduction natserve - R package wrap NatureServe’s database API rOpenSci” (#6) (#16) work done @mairindeith - thanks!

title: natserv 0.3.0
text: add vcr tests http requests cached (#18) link taxize book readme vignette (#15) improve failure behavior. NatureServe API returns 200 result found, gymnastics catch scenario (#9)

title: natserv 0.3.0
text: bug ns_data() fixed related subnations (#10) bunch checks added within ns_data(), ns_images(), ns_search() catch common bad inputs functions (#11) fixed bug internal function check_uid() throwing warnings ns_data() passing one input (#14)

title: natserv 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2017-01-03

title: natserv 0.1.4
text: natserv now requires crul >= 0.2.0, fixed URL encoding make work natserv easier.

title: natserv 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-12-15

title: natserv 0.1.0
text: released CRAN
